q: In Go, if a program calls a function inside the same function, then it is called as:
In Go, which of the following terms will you use to convert a long value into an integer and store it?

What is the output of the following C code:

    #include<stdio.h>
    int main()
    {
        int x=foo(345, 10);
        printf("%d",x);
    }
    int foo(int n,int r)
    {
        if (n  > 0)
            return (n%r +  foo (n/r, r ));
        else
            return 0;
    }

What is the output of the following C code:

    #include<stdio.h>
    int f(int *a, int n)
    {
        if(n <= 0) return 0;
        else if(*a % 2 == 0)
        return *a + f(a+1, n-1);
        else return *a - f(a+1, n-1);
        }
    int main()
    {
        int a[] = {12, 7, 13, 4, 11,0};
        printf("%d", f(a, 6));
    }
